parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma2

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00

</value></part><part><name>gr1 </name>=<value> Markers

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> local

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Sets the marker alpha. The marker is only modified on the computer where the command is called.
<br>
When alpha equals <tt>1</tt>, the marker is visible, but if alpha equals <tt>0</tt>, then the marker is invisible.
<br>
Alpha can be numbers and fractions.

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> marker '''setMarkerAlphaLocal''' alpha

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> marker: [[String]] -

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> alpha: [[Number]] -

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> Nothing

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>"my_marker" [[setMarkerAlphaLocal]] 0.5;</code>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>"enemy_convoy_marker" [[setMarkerAlphaLocal]] 0;</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[setMarkerAlpha]], [[setMarkerBrush]], [[setMarkerColor]], [[setMarkerDir]], [[setMarkerPos]], [[setMarkerShape]], [[setMarkerSize]], [[setMarkerText]], [[setMarkerType]], [[createMarker]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class='command_description'>
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate"> Posted on January 7, 2010 - 18:37 (CET)
<dt class="note">[[User:Dimitri Harkov|Dimitri Harkov]]</dt>
<dd class="note">The range for 'alpha' is 0 ... 1

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
